trans-unit.source: Injecting Custom Data into Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Injecting Custom Data into Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to inject custom data into an Azure virtual machine when the instance is created and how to locate the custom data on either Windows or Linux.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to inject custom data into an Azure virtual machine when the instance is created and how to locate the custom data on either Windows or Linux.

trans-unit.source: Injecting custom data into an Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Injecting custom data into an Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Injecting a script or other data into an Azure virtual machine when it is being provisioned is a very common scenario, regardless of whether the operating system is Windows or a Linux distribution.
trans-unit.target: Injecting a script or other data into an Azure virtual machine when it is being provisioned is a very common scenario, regardless of whether the operating system is Windows or a Linux distribution.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to:
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to:

trans-unit.source: Inject data into an Azure virtual machine when it is being provisioned.
trans-unit.target: Inject data into an Azure virtual machine when it is being provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve it for both Windows and Linux.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve it for both Windows and Linux.

trans-unit.source: Use special tools available on some systems to detect and handle custom data automatically.
trans-unit.target: Use special tools available on some systems to detect and handle custom data automatically.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article describes how custom data can be injected by using a VM created with the Azure Service Management API.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article describes how custom data can be injected by using a VM created with the Azure Service Management API.

trans-unit.source: To see how to use the Azure Resource Management API, see [the example template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-vm-customdata).
trans-unit.target: To see how to use the Azure Resource Management API, see [the example template](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-vm-customdata).

trans-unit.source: Injecting custom data into your Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Injecting custom data into your Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: This feature is currently supported only in the [Azure Command-Line Interface](https://github.com/Azure/azure-xplat-cli).
trans-unit.target: This feature is currently supported only in the [Azure Command-Line Interface](https://github.com/Azure/azure-xplat-cli).

trans-unit.source: Although you may use any of the options for the `azure vm create` command, the following demonstrates one very basic approach.
trans-unit.target: Although you may use any of the options for the `azure vm create` command, the following demonstrates one very basic approach.

trans-unit.source: Using custom data in the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Using custom data in the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: If your Azure virtual machine is a Windows-based virtual machine, then the custom data file is saved to `%SYSTEMDRIVE%\AzureData\CustomData.bin`.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure virtual machine is a Windows-based virtual machine, then the custom data file is saved to `%SYSTEMDRIVE%\AzureData\CustomData.bin`.

trans-unit.source: Although it was base64-encoded to transfer from the local computer to the new virtual machine, it is automatically decoded and can be opened or used immediately.
trans-unit.target: Although it was base64-encoded to transfer from the local computer to the new virtual machine, it is automatically decoded and can be opened or used immediately.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the file exists, it is overwritten.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the file exists, it is overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The security on the directory is set to **System:Full Control** and **Administrators:Full Control**.
trans-unit.target: The security on the directory is set to **System:Full Control** and **Administrators:Full Control**.

trans-unit.source: If your Azure virtual machine is a Linux-based virtual machine, then the custom data file will be located in the following two places.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure virtual machine is a Linux-based virtual machine, then the custom data file will be located in the following two places.

trans-unit.source: The data will be base64-encoded, so you will need to decode the data first.
trans-unit.target: The data will be base64-encoded, so you will need to decode the data first.

trans-unit.source: At `/var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml`
trans-unit.target: At `/var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml`

trans-unit.source: At `/var/lib/waagent/CustomData`
trans-unit.target: At `/var/lib/waagent/CustomData`

trans-unit.source: Cloud-init on Azure
trans-unit.target: Cloud-init on Azure

trans-unit.source: If your Azure virtual machine is from an Ubuntu or CoreOS image, then you can use CustomData to send a cloud-config to cloud-init.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure virtual machine is from an Ubuntu or CoreOS image, then you can use CustomData to send a cloud-config to cloud-init.

trans-unit.source: Or if your custom data file is a script, then cloud-init can simply execute it.
trans-unit.target: Or if your custom data file is a script, then cloud-init can simply execute it.

trans-unit.source: Ubuntu Cloud Images
trans-unit.target: Ubuntu Cloud Images

trans-unit.source: In most Azure Linux images, you would edit "/etc/waagent.conf" to configure the temporary resource disk and swap file.
trans-unit.target: In most Azure Linux images, you would edit "/etc/waagent.conf" to configure the temporary resource disk and swap file.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Linux Agent user guide](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Linux Agent user guide](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: However, on the Ubuntu Cloud Images, you must use cloud-init to configure the resource disk (that is, the "ephemeral" disk) and swap partition.
trans-unit.target: However, on the Ubuntu Cloud Images, you must use cloud-init to configure the resource disk (that is, the "ephemeral" disk) and swap partition.

trans-unit.source: See the following page on the Ubuntu wiki for more details: [AzureSwapPartitions](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AzureSwapPartitions).
trans-unit.target: See the following page on the Ubuntu wiki for more details: [AzureSwapPartitions](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AzureSwapPartitions).

trans-unit.source:
## Next steps: Using cloud-init
For further information, see the [cloud-init documentation for Ubuntu](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CloudInit).
trans-unit.target:
## Next steps: Using cloud-init
For further information, see the [cloud-init documentation for Ubuntu](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CloudInit).
